text: Do you continue to build out programs
where you directly serve
more and more students

and scale that way?
If you do that, how do you
actually maintain effectiveness?
Or do you look for other ways
to encourage and support

others to do this and
transform the sector?

Transform, address the problem
and the opportunity in a much larger way?
So I'm very tempted since I'm talking

to a Harvard Business School professor,
to make it all sound very strategic and linear.

I have to say, it was also much 
more kind of organic,

chaotic, incidental, and so on,
which doesn't sound as nice.

But I would say that among the things
we learned - Madhav spoke about

developing some elements of a
model that people can run with.
And, you know, was it planned
so that people could run with it?
or that we could run with it?
It is hard to say.
I think from the early assessment,

measurement and 
assessment experiences,

I think it was all about
how you were learning by doing

certain activities, which then
later on can become like tools.

And I think that part of what I feel we --
I hope we've been able to do --

is if you understand the problem
reasonably well,

but use simple tools,
then more people can understand it.

I think part of solving
a problem is understanding it

and being able to articulate in a way that
many more people can resonate with that.

So in this math assessment, little test
that we talked about, was really a way

of looking at something in a way
that could cut through the problem,

not complicate it, and be
able to bring it to people.

In that case, it was the city government,
but it could be to a school

or to a community to say, guys,
you know, kids are in 5th grade.

They can't do math.
Let's do something about it.

Then they say, how much
math do they not know?
And you can see, okay,

they're struggling with number
recognition, so let's go for it.

So how do you --
I think a lot of academic work,

I mean, I'm generalizing like crazy,
so you should stop me.
But, it complicates things because

the world is a complex place
and so you need a very comprehensive --

I think sometimes that gets 
in the way of normal people

wanting to do things that can
take the world forward.
